comments.content: Looks like FFDax to me. Could be Giacomo, either, a bit hard to tell at a glance. But it looks a lot like DAX, which seems to be quite en vogue these last months...

If it is Dax [http://www.fontfont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142105/http:/www.fontfont.com/)   
If it is Giacomco [http://www.terminaldesign.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142105/http:/www.terminaldesign.com/)

Since Dax doesn't have stems that extend upward past the tops of the m or n, I don't think this can be Dax. Giacomo isn't right either, if that smaller text is the same face, because it has a y with a curved tail and Giacomo's is straight. Giacomo's a has a curved tail and this font doesn't. I'm going off to search the [Sans Serif Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142105/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/SansIDPage.html).
